title: What Happened? by Hanif Kureishi, review: fanatics, footballers and ice cream
text:
Hanif Kureishi occupies a peculiar position in English letters. No longer a bad boy, though too impatient and irritable to qualify as an elder statesman, he is at risk of being taken for granted – part of the furniture, reliably there. Yet it would be hard to name a British writer of the past 40 years who matches his range of achievement.

As well as plays (Borderline, Outskirts) and film scripts (My Beautiful Laundrette, Le Week-End), novels (The Buddha of Suburbia, Something to Tell You) and short stories (“Lately”, “My Son the Fanatic”), he has regularly published non-fiction: memoirs, diaries, columns. In certain moods, when swept away by his warm, sturdy, easy-going voice, it can be possible...
description: Hanif Kureishi occupies a peculiar position in English letters.
